reviewDescription: I got it for 1499 and I guess for this price it's good enough. Don't buy if you are buying it for than this price. If you just wanna try out a smart watch, this is really nice. But if you are expecting too many features in it , then go for a pricier one. At least for this watch, u don't have too many features, and you have to use your phone to set up most of the things ( like alerts and notifications, Do not disturb mode and even alarms too!!)Other than that, its touch response is pretty decent, has got nice watch faces (you can make your own as well) and battery is long lasting (at least for my usage, lasts more than 10 days).Also notice that the wrist isn't black, its dark grey. But the dial is black

reviewDescription: Not many features i buy because my love is buy this 😁
Excellent purchase

I bought this thing for ₹2499…..Pros : This thing is a nice looking watch.All notifications from my phone is accurately coming to my watch!Many cloud watch faces and custom watch faces are a very good edition!Strap is very good quality and when you show it to sunlight you can see that it is not actually black but a realist colour which is kinda cooler than black!(If my eyes are not deceiving me!)Touch is very accurate and no delay occurs.Every tracker is quite accurate..Cons many :iPhone users beware :The find my phone option doesn’t work and it can’t take remote pictures with the IPhone’s camera app only with boAt’s app camera which is huge bummer! Bluetooth sucks..It disconnects from my phone when I go to another room than my phone! I know this isn’t my phones problem cuz I can hear music on my earbuds 2-3 rooms away!I have been using this for 1 day now….I charged it to a 100 and slept with it on my hand when I woke up and saw it was at 95% I don’t think this is going to last for 7 days! After I woke up I saw that I slept for 6 h 34 mins and I thought that was pretty accurate and I went to brush my teeth and when I looked again it had changed from that to 8h 47mins and later I found out it just copied the data from my phones time in bed feature in the health app…This just sucks!And another thing I don’t like is the music control is all the way down and I have swipe alll the way to skip my music and there is no way to change it!There is a so called,’SWIM’ workout thing and the app shows that it is not recommended to submerge the watch under water for more than 30 mins! And there is no way to reset all my health on that app! The LCD screen sucks if you look closely!Overall good watch….Might suggest you to go for something but more expensive for an IPhone…If you are on a budget this is for you!

reviewDescription: Not worth for value money

I purchased this on my friend's recommendation since he had seen someone else wear it and his initial impressions were good, plus this was on sale.The reality, both of us realized, was different.Pros:- Great looks. Feels good on your hand with that circular dial.- Build quality is good too. No complaints there, given the price (I got it for ₹1800)- Battery life was accurate for me and my friend too. No disappointments there. You can full charge and forget about it for 2 to 3 weeks.- The accessories provided were working and convenient to use.- The companion app was okay enough. Not amazing, but not bad too.Cons: I use a smart-band or watch for its features more than looks. This one disappoints in terms of features :- Inaccurate and very bland sleep tracking stats. Just numbers and no details around different sleep stages. There is a reason why you track your sleep, to improve the quality - this won't help at all.- Inaccurate step count.- Notifications just don't work on this watch it seems. Its like the watch has a mood of its own. If it is your lucky day, it may notify you of a text/email/call, otherwise forget about it. This was the biggest con for me. When I have my phone in my pocket or away and I get a notification (call/message/alarm), I can choose to reach for me phone or not based on that.  That is a big advantage IMO of a smart band/watch, but you won't find it working on this one.- There are a lot of watch faces but there would be very few that one would like to use. The makers seem to have focused more on quantity than quality.What disappointed me more was my expectation with this one while purchasing it. I have been using Honor Band 5 for over 18 months and trust me all features work really well. The tracking may not be perfect but it is still satisfactory and doesn't spoil the experience, unlike this smart watch. After using this  for 4 weeks, out of frustration I went back to using my Honor band 5 and kept this one back in the original packaging - not sure what I would do!I hope this was useful in clearing out some questions!
reviewTitle: Design and looks are good. Great battery life! Rest all disappoints!

reviewDescription: Good product

Got this watch for basic fitness tracking and notifications from phone. However, after working about normally for about 2 weeks, it stopped charging and would never switch on. Went to the service centre and got a quick replacement within two days. Even apart from this incident, the watch keeps getting disconnected from the phone often and we need to constantly open the app to check if the watch is connected. Steps counter is also not very accurate. Overall an avoidable product.

Overall I am happy for the product after 1 year of usage. Good product at the price range with nearly accurate tracking.Battery backup is something I give full credits to.No damage for any parts except the rusting of the screws in the back panel.
I will use this product but it's accuracy is not good and  no battery backup.
Nice 1

As a boat fanboy, I am pretty much satisfied with the overall package delivered by boat. The watch at a 1999 price tag has a premium metal body which feels really premium while in hand, and the straps are also of high quality material with perfect fit size slots. Connectivity is also really good, didn't face any disconnecting issues. The screen is not that bright under outdoor sunlight conditions, but does a pretty good job while outdoors. Can't say that the pedometer is accurate, it feels like it tracks extra steps but also I feel that the margin of error is pretty low for sure. But, the software is really very very bad. Like the watch really lacks due to the software. The swipe lags a lot, while tapping on one option u have to be very precise or it can select some other option, notification part only holds 6 notifications at a time, the cloud watchface doesn't appear on the watch face menu, no options for rearranging the up-swipe menu, the down-swipe menu lacks information, while creating a custom watch face the wallpaper u select from ur phone will look good on the preview window of the phone but is really horrible when it gets transferred to the watch even if the wallpaper is of good resolution.I mean, yes this watch hasn't received any updates and is very much new in the market, but many other contenders are really of to a great start at launch. I really hope boat regularly pushes updates and listens to it's customers feedbacks from time to time. I have high hopes on boat, so I chose this watch from boat instead of going in with other watch brands. boat should hear it's customers opinions about the current watch version problems and continue to make this a better watch experience. Just because of the software, it doesn't gets a good recognition in the market
